comments:
Steps to reproduce:
- Install Eclipse 3.0.1 SDK.
- Select Help > Software Updates > Find and Install...
- In that wizard, choose Search for updates of currently installed features
- Select Eclipse 3.0.2 on next page
- After download, select Yes to restart Eclipse.
- Now in Eclipse 3.0.2, select Help > Software Updates > Manage Configuration...
- Select Eclipse 3.0.2 and choose Replace with Another Version and select 3.0.1.
- After revert, select Yes to restart Eclipse.
- Now in Eclipse 3.0.1, select Help > Software Updates > Manage Configuration...
- Select Eclipse 3.0.2 and choose Uninstall.
- After uninstall, select Yes to restart Eclipse.


You'll see the following errors in the error log:

Additionally, plugins/org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.0.2/runtime.jar is not
uninstalled and actually still active when looking at the plugin details from
the IDE.

Manually deleting plugins/org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.0.2 results in Eclipse not
being able to startup.

Additionally, in a Eclipse environment in which I've defined a new product and
the primary feature is different from the org.eclipse features, any subsequent
feature modification (enable, disable, revert to previous) seems reliant on
runtime_3.0.2 and on restart I get an error in Eclipse startup that prevents
starting the IDE.

dup of bug 74585

Because osgi and runtime are automatically started, and they're picked up 
based on their latest version, when you roll back you still end up using those 
bundles. Removing them manually needs to clean the osgi cache as well (-clean).

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 74585 ***
